description: From Middle English untien, unteyen, untyȝen, untiȝen, from Old English untīġan (“to untie”), equivalent to un- +‎ tie.

verbs.description: untie (third-person singular simple present unties, present participle untying, simple past and past participle untied)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To loosen, as something interlaced or knotted; to disengage the parts of.
(transitive) To free from fastening or from restraint; to let loose; to unbind.
To resolve; to unfold; to clear.
(programming, transitive) In the Perl programming language, to undo the process of tying, so that a variable uses default instead of custom functionality.
examples: After you finish with the INI file, all you need to do is untie the hash. Then you really are finished!
